title: Duck Duck Go has been eliminated but keeps coming back
content:
When opening a new tab FF is opening Duck Duck Go after DDG has been removed. I have deleted and reinstalled FF several times, I have cleaned the cache.

I have set the homepage to https://startpage.com (SP,) I have removed the extension Duck Duck Go (DDG.) When starting FF it opens SP, but when I click on the new tab (+) it opens DDG. The trouble-shooting information below says that DDG is Enabled, but I have removed it and the extension is not listed in the Add-Ons manager.

I have set FF > Preferences > Home > ...New Windows and Tabs > Homepage and New Windows > Custom URLs... > https://startpage.com/ ...New Tabs > Firefox Home (Default)

Why is FF reverting to DDG? Where is DDG coming from? Can I stop/disable DDG from appearing?

title: When Print Preview is selected, the Bookmarks are always scrolled to the top of the listing.
content: When Print Preview is selected, the Bookmarks are always scrolled to the top of the listing. This is very inconvenient when you want to go back to where you were when you have thousands of Bookmarks. I would like to have Firefox fixed so it doesn't do this.

title: import profile
content: So apparently this isn't my night to screw with computers. I couldn't successfully import my thunderbird profile then I closed firefox and apparently when I told firefox to save my password for this help page it did not. Went to log in and got locked out for 15 minutes so I set up another account. Now I can't import my firefox profile either. Went through the steps up until I tried to open the profile manager but it won't open. I'm just about fed up with mozilla crap. Anyone have any ideas? Is there some trade secret I have to pay money for? I'm seriously fed up. Come on people make this crap easier to use.

title: How can I change tabs with scrolling mouse wheel?
content:

creator: ycere

title: Cursor has now started changing as I move around on web pages.   (Just updated to version 84)
content:
(Ubuntu 20.10 NUC 7I5 32 gig memory) I had (firefox) version 83.02 installed and working.

Today I turned on the machine, loaded Firefox and.....

It sort of crashed. I selected "reload Firefox" and things went a bit weird.

Today is 24 Dec 2020. I have had the machine on a few times since 15 Dec 2020.

Firefox restarted and YUCK! it was horrible! I had the DARK theme chosen and somehow it restarted in the other one which is ..... not dark.

The cursor is annoying at times when you are typing and I try to ignore it as much as possible, but since that which just happened I noticed the cursor is now changing its look as I move around a web page.

Looking at the release notes there is no mention of this being done.

I can't find anything in the settings/preferences/config/what ever to control the cursor. But that aside: this didn't used to happen. (No big. Just mentioning it)

If I move over a link the cursor changes from what it is to a hand (left pointing).

Is this now normal?
creator: teeny_weeny

title: Entering a number on the numpad, automatically starts CTRL+F
content:

since the recent Update 84.1, whenever I type something on the Numpad, Firefox would automatically start and search with CTRL+F through the website. This is getting extremely annoying because I use my Numpad regularly. What can I do?

That goes for loading frm their old W10 mob that they've stopped supporting (not a prob as I've now migrated to an Old Soony X I've had)... Anyone assist pls? thks

title: [Firefox com Wayland] Não é possível copiar endereço a partir da barra
content:
Olá!

Estou utilizando Firefox no Sway com Wayland em um Linux Manjaro.

Uma vez que a variável MOZ_ENABLE_WAYLAND=1 é definida, não é possível copiar o endereço da barra do Firefox para outros aplicativos.

Copiar entre o Firefox - ou seja, copiar de uma barra, criar uma nova aba e então colar funciona. Entretanto, o texto copiado não fica disponível no clipboard do sistema operacional.

Alguém tem alguma sugestão?

Obrigado, Rodrigo
creator: rramos.silva

title: When downloading xmp files, they are changed to xml
content: I download xmp files from https://discuss.pixls.us. Starting about mid-day today, when I clicked on a file to download it, the extension was changed to xml. I didn't change any settings. There might have been an update of Firefox.
